      • getBestMove

        public int getBestMove(int player,
              int[] colHeight,
              double[] vTable)
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        Based on an already existing VTable e.g., Agent.getNextVTable(int[][], boolean), select the best move for the player to move. In some cases the agent determines the values for all after-states of a position. If all these values are already available it is not necessary to call the method Agent.getBestMove(int[][]), which often would need extra time. Example: If all the values for the after-states were already calculated by a treesearch-algorithm, then we do not have to start the search again, just to find the best move, since the best move is simply determined by the after-state which maxizimizes the final outcome.
        Specified by:
        getBestMove in interface Agent
        Parameters:
        player - player, to find best move for
        colHeight - an Array containing the heights of all columns
        vTable - Values for all columns
        Returns:
        Best move for a player using the param vTable

      • getScore

        public double getScore(int[][] table,
              boolean useSigmoid)
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        For a given position determine the game-theoretic value, thus the outcome of the game, starting from this position. The implementation should be able to scale the score into the range -1 (Win Red) and +1 (Win Yellow) with 0 indicating a draw.
        Specified by:
        getScore in interface Agent
        Parameters:
        table - 7x6-board
        useSigmoid - put score in range -1 .. +1
        Returns:
        Score (Value) for the given board

      • getNextVTable

        public double[] getNextVTable(int[][] table,
                     boolean useSigmoid)
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        Determine for a given position the values of all possible actions (after-states).
        Specified by:
        getNextVTable in interface Agent
        Parameters:
        table - 7x6-board
        useSigmoid - put values in range -1 .. +1
        Returns:
        table containing the values for each column of the board.

      • semOpDown

        public void semOpDown()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the DOWN-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with Agent.semOpUp().
        Specified by:
        semOpDown in interface Agent

      • semOpUp

        public void semOpUp()
        Description copied from interface: Agent
        If Threads are used, which multiply access the agents, then ensure that only one thread has mutual exclusive access. This is the UP-Operation on the semaphore (MUTEX). This method should be used in combination with Agent.semOpDown().
        Specified by:
        semOpUp in interface Agent
